ticket.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for
ticket.original-body:
@@@ <%= error_messages_for 'order' %> @@@
Double escapes messages. Example from Agile Web Development on Rails, third edition, page 200:
@@@ es: activerecord: attributes: order: address: "Dirección" errors: messages: inclusion: "no está incluido en la lista" @@@
Full [es.yml](http://media.pragprog.com/titles/rails3/code/depot_s/config/locales/en.yml).
The output produced includes:
@@@ * Direccxón no puede quedar en blanco * Forma de pago no está incluido en la lista @@@
Note: this worked in Rails 2.2, and continues to work as expected in Rails 2.3 for selection boxes and labels.
The full [makedepot.rb](http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR3/makedepot.rb) is available if it helps to reproduce the problem.
ticket.latest-body:
@@@ <%= error_messages_for 'order' %> @@@
Double escapes messages. Example from Agile Web Development on Rails, third edition, page 200:
@@@ es: activerecord: attributes: order: address: "Dirección" errors: messages: inclusion: "no está incluido en la lista" @@@
Full [es.yml](http://media.pragprog.com/titles/rails3/code/depot_s/config/locales/en.yml).
The output produced includes:
@@@ * Direccxón no puede quedar en blanco * Forma de pago no está incluido en la lista @@@
Note: this worked in Rails 2.2, and continues to work as expected in Rails 2.3 for selection boxes and labels.
The full [makedepot.rb](http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR3/makedepot.rb) is available if it helps to reproduce the problem.
ticket.original-body-html:
<%= error_messages_for 'order' %>

Double escapes messages. Example from Agile Web Development on Rails, third edition, page 200:


es:
  activerecord:
    attributes:
      order:
        address: "Dirección"
    errors:
      messages:
        inclusion: "no está incluido en la lista"

Full es.yml.

The output produced includes:


    * Direccxón no puede quedar en blanco
    * Forma de pago no está incluido en la lista

Note: this worked in Rails 2.2, and continues to work as expected in Rails 2.3 for selection boxes and labels.

The full makedepot.rb is available if it helps to reproduce the problem.

Note: this worked in Rails 2.2, and continues to work as expected in Rails 2.3 for selection boxes and labels.

The full makedepot.rb is available if it helps to reproduce the problem.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body: Appears to be a deliberate change made in http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/45494580d9405e80ba124d17c8379436883c8c78 in response to #1280
version.body-html: Appears to be a deliberate change made in http://github.com/rails/rails/co... in response to #1280
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body:
OK, it was clearly deliberate, but I will argue that it also is unfortunate, not backwards compatible with 2.2, and not consistent with how labels and selection boxes work in 2.3.
I say unfortunate, as I have a use case in mind: expressing characters which can not be conveniently be entered using the keyboard.
See also Agile Web Development with Rails [errata 38578](http://pragprog.com/titles/rails3/errata#e38578).
version.body-html:
OK, it was clearly deliberate, but I will argue that it also is unfortunate, not backwards compatible with 2.2, and not consistent with how labels and selection boxes work in 2.3.

I say unfortunate, as I have a use case in mind: expressing characters which can not be conveniently be entered using the keyboard.

See also Agile Web Development with Rails errata 38578.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body: Why wouldn't you just á and ó in the error message? Presumably your HTML is being returned as UTF-8, so you should be good. It seems more confusing that < and > are not escaped when used legitimately. IMO, the model shouldn't be doing any escaping. It's errors could well be rendered in contexts other than HTML.
version.body-html: Why wouldn't you just á and ó in the error message? Presumably your HTML is being returned as UTF-8, so you should be good. It seems more confusing that < and > are not escaped when used legitimately. IMO, the model shouldn't be doing any escaping. It's errors could well be rendered in contexts other than HTML.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body:
The problem is that some view methods (e.g., labels and selection boxes) don't escape, and some do. At the minimum, this is poorly documented, but potentially could represent a security exposure. I'd like to keep this ticket open for the moment (assigned to me is fine) as I plan to investigate and report back on the inconsistencies so that collectively the core team can determine what the right fix is.
I'm marking the priority as low as I don't believe that this should block a beta.
version.body-html:
The problem is that some view methods (e.g., labels and selection boxes) don't escape, and some do. At the minimum, this is poorly documented, but potentially could represent a security exposure. I'd like to keep this ticket open for the moment (assigned to me is fine) as I plan to investigate and report back on the inconsistencies so that collectively the core team can determine what the right fix is.

I'm marking the priority as low as I don't believe that this should block a beta.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body: (#3401 was resolved that i18n messages are html-safe when using the t helper.)
version.body-html: (#3401 was resolved that i18n messages are html-safe when using the t helper.)
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body:
"i18n messages are html-safe when using the t helper"
The net effect of that is the answer to "are i18n messages considered to be html-safe?" is "it depends"; which, while true, is unfortunate. And furthermore, in many cases it depends on implementation details inside of Rails.
My two cents: this needs to be looked at as a whole picture for consistency. Individual aspects:
1) number_to_currency takes in a number of html_safe values (including precision, delimiter, and separator), and produces a non-safe result. http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR4/checkdepot-191.html#issue-6 This affects all of the number_helpers
2) Validation messages do similar things: concatenating html_safe values, producing a result that is not considered safe, so therefore is escaped again. http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR4/checkdepot-191.html#issue-7
3) A number of helpers that produce HTML (examples mentioned above: labels and selection boxes) will take unsafe HTML and *NOT* escape it. Example: submit_tag, select_tag ... options_for_select.
version.body-html:
"i18n messages are html-safe when using the t helper"

The net effect of that is the answer to "are i18n messages considered to be html-safe?" is "it depends"; which, while true, is unfortunate. And furthermore, in many cases it depends on implementation details inside of Rails.

My two cents: this needs to be looked at as a whole picture for consistency. Individual aspects:

1) number_to_currency takes in a number of html_safe values (including precision, delimiter, and separator), and produces a non-safe result. http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR4/checkdepot-191.html#issue-6 This affects all of the number_helpers

2) Validation messages do similar things: concatenating html_safe values, producing a result that is not considered safe, so therefore is escaped again. http://intertwingly.net/projects/AWDwR4/checkdepot-191.html#issue-7

3) A number of helpers that produce HTML (examples mentioned above: labels and selection boxes) will take unsafe HTML and NOT escape it. Example: submit_tag, select_tag ... options_for_select.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body:
Another issue, noticed by inspection:
* html_escape (action_view/erb/util.rb) respects html_safe
* escape_once (action_view/helpers/tag_helper.rb) does not respect html_safe
version.body-html:
Another issue, noticed by inspection:

  • html_escape (action_view/erb/util.rb) respects html_safe

  • escape_once (action_view/helpers/tag_helper.rb) does not respect html_safe
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body:
FWIW, I agree with Sam's expectations about how files should act.
If you have an application file, that file's contents should be considered trusted. Since the new html_safe is supposed to be source/datastream-oriented in terms of determining safety, it should consider files deployed as part of the application safe.
I would also expect submit_tag et al to perform the proper escaping and enforce html_safe. An easy use-case is a build-your-own-form site, where users can create text to put on buttons. This text is definitely not safe. By contrast, if the button text came from a file, for example localizations so English/French/German can display the correct "Submit" text, then that text should be considered safe since it came from a file.
version.body-html:
FWIW, I agree with Sam's expectations about how files should act.

If you have an application file, that file's contents should be considered trusted. Since the new html_safe is supposed to be source/datastream-oriented in terms of determining safety, it should consider files deployed as part of the application safe.

I would also expect submit_tag et al to perform the proper escaping and enforce html_safe. An easy use-case is a build-your-own-form site, where users can create text to put on buttons. This text is definitely not safe. By contrast, if the button text came from a file, for example localizations so English/French/German can display the correct "Submit" text, then that text should be considered safe since it came from a file.
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body: I18n messages are not considered html_safe unless you use the t() helper in views and the message key finishes with _html. This means t("foo.bar.baz_html") will return a html safe string. The fact number helper issues are not escaped is a bug and patches are welcome! :) Feel free to open up a new ticket and assign it to me!
version.body-html: I18n messages are not considered html_safe unless you use the t() helper in views and the message key finishes with _html. This means t("foo.bar.baz_html") will return a html safe string. The fact number helper issues are not escaped is a bug and patches are welcome! :) Feel free to open up a new ticket and assign it to me!
version.title: activerecord double escapes error_messages_for

version.body: While selecting a luggage set for your outings the most important thing which one should be considered louis vuitton loafers for men louis vuitton shoes for men is the size.Considering the amount of the belongings that is to be taken along should be taken louis vuitton flip flops into account.These are available in variety of sizes and you need to select one of your choices gucci sandals which best suites you. These louis vuitton jeans are very fashionable and stylish and are very well complimented with their features of functionality and performance.They are available in duffle style bags, hard sided or hanging luggage.These are available in two, three, five or eight pieces sets.
version.body-html:
While selecting a luggage set for your outings the most important thing which one should be considered louis vuitton loafers for men louis vuitton shoes for men is the size.Considering the amount of the belongings that is to be taken along should be taken louis vuitton flip flops into account.These are available in variety of sizes and you need to select one of your choices gucci sandals which best suites you.
These louis vuitton jeans are very fashionable and stylish and are very well complimented with their features of functionality and performance.They are available in duffle style bags, hard sided or hanging luggage.These are available in two, three, five or eight pieces sets.

version.body: Remember what should be remembered, and forget what should be forgotten.Alter what is changeable, and accept what is mutable.Apart from tears, only time could wear everything away..When I was asked to give a ugg classic cardy write-up, on the topic Life is Beautiful I smiled. I believed it uggs classic cardy was a simple topic with a very simple proposition. With a firm belief in myself, I tried to pen a few bailey button fancy words. I found myself helpless as I had fiddled away precious bailey button uggs time. Apparently an innocuous proposition made me ponder, which began in a cheap ugg boots argyle listless way and later took a definite direction.As my thought process gained some classic argyle knit ugg boots ground, I could not fathom the depth of this topic nor scale the uggs mini height of it. At one time I thought it could be dealt by filling the write up with anecdotes of my short mini uggs life and thus proving Life is Beautiful. The very next instance made me shudder, as a serious ugg boots ultra topic should be dealt philosophically. A chain developed with one approach giving way to the other.As we grew old ugg ultra tall boots sale together, I would tease you that you had not changed since we first met. But it is true, my uggs tall women darling. I do not see the wrinkles and grey hair that other people see. When I look at you ugg black classic tall sale now, I only see your sweet tender lips and youthful sparkling eyes as we sat and had out first picnic next black short ugg to that small stream, and chased each other around ugg black short that big old oak tree. I remember wishing those sundance ugg boots first few days together would last forever. Do you remember how exciting and wonderful those chestnut ugg boots nightfall days were? ZHC

I believed it uggs classic cardy was a simple topic with a very simple proposition. With a firm belief in myself, I tried to pen a few bailey button fancy words. I found myself helpless as I had fiddled away precious bailey button uggs time. Apparently an innocuous proposition made me ponder, which began in a cheap ugg boots argyle listless way and later took a definite direction.As my thought process gained some classic argyle knit ugg boots ground, I could not fathom the depth of this topic nor scale the uggs mini height of it. At one time I thought it could be dealt by filling the write up with anecdotes of my short mini uggs life and thus proving Life is Beautiful. The very next instance made me shudder, as a serious ugg boots ultra topic should be dealt philosophically. A chain developed with one approach giving way to the other.As we grew old ugg ultra tall boots sale together, I would tease you that you had not changed since we first met. But it is true, my uggs tall women darling. I do not see the wrinkles and grey hair that other people see. When I look at you ugg black classic tall sale now, I only see your sweet tender lips and youthful sparkling eyes as we sat and had out first picnic next black short ugg to that small stream, and chased each other around ugg black short that big old oak tree. I remember wishing those sundance ugg boots first few days together would last forever. Do you remember how exciting and wonderful those chestnut ugg boots nightfall days were? ZHC

version.body: 私の中で、総合評価のとっても低いアバアバクロホリスタークロ銀座店。アバクロは大好きなんですけどね。一昨日の東京駅付近での打ち合わせの後、散歩がてら久々に行ってきました。そしたらビックリ！相変わらアバクロず、踊っているだけの店員さんとかもいましたが、
